subject: Re: [junit] Junit with eclipse 2.0 and running plugin tests
msgSnippet: Queer.  I am unsure, but I am cc ing someone who might know.  Also, you may try posting at Eclipse and see if you get any response.  If Erich is still trolling
messageBody:
Queer. I am unsure, but I am cc'ing someone who might know. Also, you
may try posting at Eclipse and see if you get any response. If Erich is
still trolling here he should be able to tell you.

=jason

On Fri, 2002-08-09 at 08:39, Peter Graves wrote:
----- Original Message -----
From: "Jason Rogers" <jacaetevha@...>
To: "JUnit Yahoo Group" <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, August 09, 2002 12:54 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] Junit with eclipse 2.0 and running plugin tests


> A little clarification would be nice...
>
> > After installing that, the Run As->Junit Workbench is not
available.
>
> This statement does not jive with the next.
>
> > ... If I
> > just do a Run as -> Junit Test, then I can at least run simple
tests.
>
> Not trying to be picky, just trying to get the facts straight.
>
Not having used junit to test Eclipse stuff before, I am going on some
assumptions, but
I believe they both (should?) do something different. The Run As ->
Junit
test just seems to
load up the class to test and runs the tests. With anything other then
very
simple plug-in tests
you would need a full Eclipse workbench to be running with your plugins
installed to be able to do the tests, which is what I assumed the Run
As->
Junit Workbench was indended to do.
Am I way off base here?

Thanks
-Peter
